alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 11:24AM CDT until May 11 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From this evening to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, State Highway 216 affected. Extensive acreage near Harris Brake Lake and the Wildlife Management Area are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 28.9 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 24.7 Thu 7 AM 26.2 26.6 28.4 28.9 1 AM 5/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
